items.name: UIElementRectangle
items.content: # =================================================================== # # Script: UIElementRectangle # # $$COPYRIGHT$$ # # =================================================================== class UIElementRectangle extends Rect ###* * An ui rectangle is like a regular gs.Rect rectangle but if one of the * rectangle's coordinates is changed the needsUpdate property of the * assigned game object will be set to true to trigger a refresh. * * @module ui * @class UIElementRectangle * @extends gs.Rect * @memberof ui * @constructor * @params {Object} object - The UI object the rectangle belongs to. ### constructor: (object) -> ###* * The UI object the rectangle belongs to. * @property object * @type gs.Object_UIElement ### @object = object ? {} ###* * The x-coordinate of the rectangle. * @property x * @type number ### @x = 0 ###* * The y-coordinate of the rectangle. * @property y * @type number ### @y = 0 ###* * The width of the rectangle. * @property width * @type number ### @width = 1 ###* * The height of the rectangle. * @property height * @type number ### @height = 1 @accessors "x", set: (x) -> if x != @x_ @x_ = x @object.needsUpdate = yes get: -> @x_ @accessors "y", set: (y) -> if y != @y_ @y_ = y @object.needsUpdate = yes get: -> @y_ @accessors "width", set: (width) -> if width != @width_ @width_ = width @object.needsUpdate = yes get: -> @width_ @accessors "height", set: (height) -> if height != @height_ @height_ = height @object.needsUpdate = yes get: -> @height_ toRect: -> new gs.Rect(@x, @y, @width, @height) @fromRect: (object, rect) -> result = new ui.UIElementRectangle(object) result.x = rect.x result.y = rect.y result.width = rect.width result.height = rect.height return result ui.UIElementRectangle = UIElementRectangle
